explanation: Agent A is correct. In the build configuration where MHD_ASAN_POISON_ACTIVE is defined but neither HAVE___ASAN_REGION_IS_POISONED nor HAVE___ASAN_ADDRESS_IS_POISONED is defined, the code executes the branch that does need_red_zone_before = true; immediately before the test if (need_red_zone_before). After preprocessing the assignment is a constant true, so the controlling expression evaluates to true in all runs of that translation unit — i.e. it is invariant. This is not one of the permitted exceptions to MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 (it is not an infinite loop nor the special do-while case), so the code violates Rule 14.3 in that configuration. Note that in other configurations (when the HAVE___ASAN_* macros are defined) the expression may be non‑invariant, but the scenario given (neither macro defined) yields a valid Rule 14.3 violation.
